description: Learn how to style text using CSS fonts, alignment, decoration, and spacing properties.

slides.title: Font Family
Font Size
slides.content:
# Font Size üìè

The `font-size` property sets the size of the text.

## Units
- **px**: Absolute pixels. Fixed size. Good for controlling exact layout.
- **em**: Relative to the parent element's font size. `1em` = current font size.
- **rem**: Relative to the root (`html`) element's font size.
- **%**: Relative to parent.

```css
h1 {
  font-size: 2.5rem; /* 2.5x the root size */
}
```

slides.title: Font Weight
slides.content:
# Font Weight üèãÔ∏è

The `font-weight` property sets how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed.

- `normal` (400)
- `bold` (700)
- `lighter`
- `bolder`
- Numeric values: 100, 200, ... 900.

```css
p.thick {
  font-weight: bold;
}
```

slides.title: Text Alignment
slides.content:
# Text Alignment üìê

The `text-align` property is used to set the horizontal alignment of a text.

- `left` (default in LTR languages)
- `right`
- `center`
- `justify` (stretches lines so every line has equal width)

```css
h1 {
  text-align: center;
}
```

slides.title: Text Decoration
slides.content:
# Text Decoration üéÄ

The `text-decoration` property is used to add or remove decorations from text.

- `none`: Removes underline from links.
- `overline`
- `line-through`: Strikethrough.
- `underline`

```css
a {
  text-decoration: none;
}
```

slides.title: Text Transformation
Line Height
slides.content:
# Line Height ‚ÜïÔ∏è

The `line-height` property specifies the height of a line.

It's often referred to as "leading".

- `1` (normal)
- `1.5` (150% of the font size) - Recommended for readability.
- `2` (double spacing)

```css
p {
  line-height: 1.6;
}
```

slides.title: Letter Spacing
Google Fonts
slides.content:
# Using Google Fonts üåç

Don't rely on standard fonts only. Use Google Fonts!

1. Go to fonts.google.com.
2. Select styles.
3. Copy the `<link>` code to your `<head>`.

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Sofia">
<style>
body {
  font-family: "Sofia", sans-serif;
}
</style>
```

Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Typography üéì

Make your words look good.

- **Font:** `font-family` (fallback system).
- **Size:** Use `rem` for accessible sizing.
- **Weight:** `bold` or numbers (100-900).
- **Spacing:** `line-height` for paragraphs, `letter-spacing` for headlines.
- **Style:** `text-transform` and `text-decoration`.
